ko: 남이 잘못했다고 해서 너도 똑같이 잘못하는 건 옳지 않아.

en: Two wrongs do not make a right.
ko: 잘못을 잘못으로 갚는다고 해서 그게 정당해지는 건 아니야.

en: You shouldn't depend on others too much.
You shouldn't depend too much on other people to help you.
Do not look too much to others for help.
Do unto others as you would have others do unto you.
ko: 네가 대접받고 싶은 대로 남을 대접해.

en: Do to others as you would be done by?
ko: 남이 네게 해주길 바라는 대로 너도 남에게 해줘?

en: You will go your way, whatever others say.
ko: 남들이 뭐라 하든 넌 네 길을 갈 거야.

en: The fault of another is a good teacher.
The invasion of other countries is a shameful action.
ko: 다른 나라를 침략하는 건 부끄러운 일이야.

en: Is there life on other planets?
I don't know about the others, but as for me, I'm for it.
All the other issues are subordinate to this one.
ko: 다른 문제들은 다 이 문제에 비하면 부차적인 거야.

en: If we can't get the money in any other way, we can, as a last resort, sell the car.
ko: 돈 구할 다른 방법이 없으면 마지막 수단으로 차라도 팔아야지.

en: If we don't obtain an adequate knowledge of their culture, a lot of problems could easily arise.
ko: 그쪽 문화를 제대로 모르면 여러 가지 문제가 생기기 쉬워.

en: In other cultures, the balls were filled with earth, grain, bits and pieces of plants, and sometimes even pieces of metal.
ko: 다른 문화권에서는 공 안에 흙이나 곡물, 식물 조각, 심지어 금속 조각을 채워 넣기도 했어.

en: Someone else profits from the situation.
ko: 다른 사람이 이 상황에서 이득을 보네.

en: Some animals have advanced far ahead of others.
ko: 어떤 동물들은 다른 동물들보다 훨씬 앞서 진화했어.

en: The guys are sleeping like dogs.
Other restaurants serve chicken without anything that makes it stand out.
ko: 다른 식당들은 딱히 특별할 거 없는 치킨을 내놔.

en: Nobody else can.
You'll have to ask someone else.
Please ask someone else.
I have to study hard to keep up with the other students.
ko: 다른 애들 따라가려면 공부 열심히 해야 돼.

en: The others paid no attention to her warning.
ko: 다른 사람들은 걔 경고에 신경도 안 썼어.

en: One should not make fun of others.
I can't think of anybody else.
Where are all the others?
Don't blame another for his faults.
You don't have to think you aren't going to make it just because others have failed.
ko: 남들이 실패했다고 해서 너도 안 될 거라고 생각할 필요 없어.

en: I will go provided that the others go.
If other conditions are equal, the temperature must be the most influential element in this experiment.
ko: 다른 조건이 같다면 이 실험에서 온도가 가장 큰 영향을 줄 거야.

en: The other boys smiled.
Other things being equal, I choose the cheaper one.
ko: 조건이 같다면 난 더 싼 걸로 할래.

en: The other children laughed.
You had better consult the others.
ko: 다른 사람들이랑 상의해 보는 게 좋겠어.

en: No nation can exist completely isolated from others.
ko: 어떤 나라도 다른 나라들과 완전히 고립되어서 존재할 수는 없어.

en: Like any company, we've got to look ahead and plan for the future.
ko: 어느 회사나 그렇듯 우리도 앞을 내다보고 미래를 계획해야 해.

en: Could you show me another one?
ko: 다른 것 좀 보여줄 수 있어?

en: Do you have any others?
Could you recommend another hotel?
ko: 다른 호텔 추천해 줄 수 있어?

en: May I recommend another hotel?
No other book is read as widely as the Bible.
Could you do me a favor?
Turn right at the intersection.
Can you turn on the light, please?
Whose turn is it?
I want to know who's coming with us.
ko: 우리랑 누가 같이 가는지 알고 싶어.

en: Don't forget your ticket.
Here's your change.
Put your hand down.
Her nature takes more kindly to acting than to any other kind of job.
ko: 걔 성격에는 연기가 다른 어떤 일보다 잘 맞아.

en: It's never too late to learn.
If two people are in agreement, one of them is unnecessary.
ko: 두 사람 의견이 똑같으면 그중 한 명은 필요 없는 거야.

en: Please close the door when you leave.
Even if everything else is considered, I still don't like this plan.
ko: 이것저것 다 고려해 봐도 이 계획은 여전히 별로야.

en: He's only got one shirt because all the rest are being washed.
ko: 나머지는 다 빨래 중이라 셔츠가 하나밖에 없어.

en: I want to deal with this letter before I do anything else.
ko: 다른 일 하기 전에 이 편지부터 처리하고 싶어.

en: If you need more information, we are happy to send it.
No other way.
I had no other choice.
If you want to include other information, please let us know.
Is there anything I must do?
ko: 내가 꼭 해야 할 일이 있어?

en: What else do you want?
Do you have any other questions?
Anything else, sir?
Need anything else?
Do you need anything else?
Did you want anything else?
Anything else?
I can't think otherwise.
No one else can fill that job.
ko: 그 일은 다른 누구도 할 수 없어.

en: Is there anything I can do for you now?
ko: 지금 내가 뭐 도와줄 거 있어?

en: The whole village came out to welcome him.
ko: 마을 사람들 전부가 그를 환영하러 나왔어.

en: The villagers supported a new road.
ko: 마을 사람들은 새 도로를 내는 걸 지지했어.

en: Mr Murata, this is my friend Lisa.
ko: 무라타 씨, 이쪽은 제 친구 리사예요.

en: Mr. Murata, this is my friend Lisa.
ko: 무라타 씨, 이쪽은 제 친구 리사예요.

en: Everybody in the village knew him.
The village people built a wooden bridge across the river.
ko: 마을 사람들이 강에 나무 다리를 놓았어.

en: The people of the village built a wooden bridge across the river.
ko: 마을 사람들이 강에 나무 다리를 만들었어.

en: The villagers had a bias against any newcomer.
ko: 마을 사람들은 외지인에 대해 편견이 있었어.

en: The village people called the old woman Meta.
ko: 마을 사람들은 그 노인을 메타라고 불렀어.

en: Do you want a cup of coffee?
Hello, how are you?
The villagers were kind to their visitors.
The village people had to pump water from the well by hand.
ko: 마을 사람들은 우물에서 손으로 물을 길어야 했어.

en: All the villagers in turn saluted the priest.
ko: 모든 마을 사람들이 돌아가며 신부님께 인사했어.

en: The villagers regarded the stranger as their enemy.
ko: 마을 사람들은 그 이방인을 적으로 여겼어.

en: The villagers went in search of the missing child.
ko: 마을 사람들은 실종된 아이를 찾으러 나섰어.

en: No one in the village knew that the soldiers were taking aim at their village.
ko: 마을 사람 중 누구도 군인들이 마을을 겨냥하고 있다는 걸 몰랐어.

en: The villagers petitioned against the nuclear power plant.
ko: 마을 사람들은 원자력 발전소 반대 청원을 냈어.

en: Don't play dumb!
Welcome.
Love makes you blind.
All the villagers went out into the hills to look for a missing cat.
ko: 마을 사람들 모두가 잃어버린 고양이를 찾으러 산으로 갔어.

en: The villagers tried to freeze us out.
The villagers were offhand with us.
The festival is looked forward to by the villagers.
What on Earth is this?
Villagers were going to celebrate the wine festival.
ko: 마을 사람들은 와인 축제를 열려고 했어.

en: The villagers believed in a life after death.
It was the hungry bears that the villagers were afraid of.
ko: 마을 사람들이 무서워한 건 배고픈 곰들이었어.

en: There is Mr James who they say is the richest man in the village.
ko: 마을에서 제일가는 부자라는 제임스 씨가 있어.

en: The Murais have been married for ten years.
The Murais have gone back to Japan?
It is a long way to the village.
It is not more than two miles to the village.
The road to the village is very rough.
Winds haunt the village.
The village was dead after sunset.
ko: 해진 뒤 마을은 죽은 듯이 조용했어.

en: It was less than one kilometer to the village post office.
There is a lake on the east of the village.
The election of the village headman had been postponed.
All the villagers know of the accident.
ko: 마을 사람들 다 그 사고에 대해 알아.

en: Everybody in the village looks up to him.
The discussion the villagers had on the environment was quite lively.
ko: 마을 사람들이 환경에 대해 나눈 토론은 꽤 활기찼어.

en: There's an old tower in the center of the village.
ko: 마을 한복판에 오래된 탑이 하나 있어.

en: Let's go.
Let's hit the road.
Don't talk rubbish!
There was a tornado in the village.
There were no people in the village.
Not a soul was to be seen in the village.
ko: 마을에 사람 그림자 하나 안 보였어.

en: There are not many amusements in the village.
Let's make it a fair trade.
The loss amounted to 100 dollars.
It's on the tip of my tongue.
The loss amounted to $2,000,000.
The loss adds up to more than one million dollars.
I am ready to do anything to make up for the loss.
ko: 손해를 메우기 위해서라면 뭐든 할 준비가 돼 있어.

en: The extent of the damage is inestimable.
ko: 피해 규모가 가늠할 수 없을 정도야.

en: Losses will run into millions of dollars.
I am afraid the loss will amount to one hundred million dollars.
The loss amounts to a million dollars.
And, I'm your coach.
The loss amounts to ten million dollars.
The damage amounted to five million yen.
Bill took the blame for the loss.
ko: 빌이 그 손실에 대해 책임을 졌어.

en: You cannot lose.
The child looks up to his father with worship in his eyes.
ko: 그 아이는 아빠를 정말 존경하는 눈빛으로 봐.

en: Do you have anyone to look up to?
It made Grandfather's day when his granddaughter gave him a picture she had drawn of him.
ko: 손녀가 자기를 그린 그림을 줬을 때 할아버지는 정말 기뻐하셨어.

en: Being with her grandson always makes her happy.
ko: 손주랑 같이 있으면 그녀는 항상 행복해해.

en: Let's enjoy ourselves to our heart's content.
My grandchildren give me such a delight.
The work must be finished before noon.
The work has to be finished before noon.
It was not until then that I realized my mistake.
Don't pull my sleeve.
Have you decided on the subject of your thesis?
The graduation is two months ahead.
The graduation ceremony will take place on March 20th.
The graduation ceremony took place on the morning of the first of March.
Father gave me a book for graduation.
On leaving school, we presented him with a table clock as a token of our thanks.
ko: 졸업하면서 감사의 표시로 그분께 탁상시계를 선물했어.

en: As soon as he graduated, he left town.
I met her a long time after graduation, and she had totally become a housewife.
ko: 졸업하고 한참 뒤에 만났는데 완전히 주부가 됐더라고.

en: What will you do after graduation?
What'll you do after graduation?
Do you wish to make any other transaction?
ko: 다른 거래 더 할 거 있어?

en: He went on to demonstrate how to use the machine.
ko: 그는 이어서 기계 사용법을 시연해 보였어.

en: The explosion that followed killed many people.
The thief entered the house at the back door by the open window.
ko: 도둑이 뒷문 근처의 열린 창문으로 집에 들어왔어.

en: Burglars broke into his house.
There are several ways to measure speed.
ko: 속도 재는 방법은 여러 가지가 있어.
